intro: Hedysarum scabrum, commonly known as Scotch broom, is a flowering plant native to Europe, western Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant is known for its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil, making it an important species in ecological restoration. It thrives in a variety of soil types but prefers well-drained conditions and full sun. Hedysarum scabrum is also valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in traditional medicine.
